entries.title: Pope Benedict's funeral tomorrow will make history
entries.description: He made history during his life and now Pope Benedict XVI will do so in death.

entries.title: 'I am ashamed of myself': Mastermind behind US college admissions scandal locked up
entries.description: The mastermind behind the US college admissions scandal which saw celebrities and prominent figures use their wealth and privilege to buy their children places in top universities has been jailed.

entries.title: Friend gives update on NFL player Damar Hamlin's condition
entries.description: The health of Damar Hamlin, the American footballer who collapsed during a game, is "moving in a positive direction", a friend has said.

entries.title: Meta fined for forcing users to agree to personalised adverts
entries.description: Meta has been hit with a €390m fine (£343m) fine by European regulators for forcing users to agree to personalised adverts.

entries.title: Patients waiting on beds outside Chinese hospitals struggling with spiralling COVID cases
entries.description: Patients in China are being forced to wait in beds outside entrances and along corridors as hospitals continue to struggle with rising COVID-19 infections.

entries.title: Why the Republicans are struggling to pick a new House speaker
entries.description: It's been 100 years since American politics has faced a comparable mess.

entries.title: WHO 'really concerned' about COVID picture with 'intense transmission in several parts of the world'
entries.description: The World Health Organisation says it is concerned about "risk to life" in China amid a surge in COVID-19 cases, while in Europe and the US the Omicron subvariant XBB.1.5 is spreading rapidly.

entries.title: WHO 'really concerned' about COVID situation
entries.description: The World Health Organisation says it is concerned about "risk to life" in China amid a surge in COVID-19 cases, while in Europe and the US the Omicron subvariant XBB.1.5 is spreading rapidly.

entries.title: Iranian actress released from prison after showing support for executed prisoner
entries.description: An Iranian actress has been released from prison three weeks after being arrested for "spreading falsehoods" and supporting anti-government protests.

entries.title: French climate activists spray-paint front of prime minister's office
entries.description: Two climate activists spray-painted the front entrance of Prime Minister Elisabeth Borne's office in protest of what the group called "climate crimes".

entries.title: Teachers, plumbers and builders among Ukraine's volunteer soldiers preparing for worst on Belarus border
entries.description: In the forest and snowed-over swamps of Ukraine's 621-mile border with Belarus is a territorial defence unit gearing up for the worst.

entries.title: Dramatic lack of snow in ski resorts revealed in satellite images as heat records 'annihilated'
entries.description: Striking satellite images have revealed dirty brown hillsides around what should be pristine, white snow-covered ski resorts as record-breaking January heat hits all over Europe.

entries.title: Apple's value drops as interest rates, supply woes and recession fears batter tech industry
entries.description: In a stark contrast to the start of 2022, Apple began this year with $1trn (£829bn) wiped off its market value as tech companies face strong headwinds from higher interest rates, production problems and global economic concerns.

entries.title: British man shot dead in Jamaica while standing by pool
entries.description: A British man has died after being shot in the head in Jamaica.

entries.title: Chaos in US House as Republican hardliners block new speaker
entries.description: The Republicans have been plunged into turmoil after hardline members repeatedly blocked the appointment of a new House of Representatives speaker.

entries.title: Quadruple student murder suspect will be extradited to Idaho to face charges
entries.description: The man suspected of stabbing to death four university students in their beds will be taken to Idaho to face murder charges after he voluntarily agreed to be extradited.
